intro: Gelasine nuda, commonly known as the naked gelasine, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
